FUMBLES.name: Table 4-2: Fumbles
FUMBLES.description: Universal fumbles table; roll die based on armor and adjust by reverse Luck.

0-.title: Miss wildly
0-.effect: You miss wildly but miraculously cause no other damage.

1.title: Laughingstock
1.effect: Your incompetent blow makes you the laughingstock of the party but otherwise causes no damage.

2.title: Trip; recover or go prone
2.effect: You trip but may recover with a DC 10 Ref save; otherwise, you must spend the next round prone.

3.title: Loose grip
3.effect: Your weapon comes loose in your hand. You quickly grab it, but your grip is disrupted. You take a -2 penalty on your next attack roll.

4.title: Weapon damaged
4.effect: Your weapon is damaged: a bowstring breaks, a sword hilt falls off, or a crossbow jams. The weapon can be repaired with 10 minutes of work but is useless for now.

5.title: Trip and fall
5.effect: You trip and fall, wasting this action. You are prone and must use an action to stand next round.

6.title: Entangled in armor
6.effect: Your weapon becomes entangled in your armor. You must spend your next round untangling them. Your armor bonus is reduced by 1 until you spend 10 minutes refitting the buckles and straps.

7.title: Drop weapon
7.effect: You drop your weapon. You must retrieve it or draw a new one on your next action.

8.title: Smash weapon
8.effect: You smash your weapon against a solid object. Mundane weapons are ruined; magical weapons are not affected.

9.title: Wide open
9.effect: You stumble and leave yourself wide open to attack. The next enemy that attacks you receives a +2 bonus on its attack roll.

10.title: Armor seizes up
10.effect: You should have maintained your armor! The joints seize up, freezing you in place. You cannot move or make an attack for 1d3 rounds. Unarmored characters are not affected.

11.title: Off balance
11.effect: Your wild swing leaves you off balance. You take a -4 penalty to your next attack roll.

12.title: Hit ally
12.effect: You inadvertently swing at one randomly determined ally within range. Make an attack roll against that ally using the same attack die you just attempted to use.

13.title: Fall hard
13.effect: You trip badly and fall hard, suffering 1d3 damage. You are prone and must use your next round to stand.

14.title: Turtle on back
14.effect: Like a turtle on its back, you slip and land upside down, unable to right yourself. Fight from prone for the next round before you can rise.

15.title: Self-inflicted wound
15.effect: You somehow manage to wound yourself, taking normal damage.

16+.title: Self-strike and topple
16+.effect: You accidentally strike yourself for normal damage plus an extra 1 point. In addition, you fall on your back and are unable to right yourself until you make a DC 16 Agility check.
